head.title: Coronavirus - Sugar Valley Rural Charter School

meta.content: At the Sugar Valley Rural Charter School, the health, safety and well-being of our students and staff are our top priorities. With the recently elevated discussion regarding the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the news, we want to take a moment to reinforce preventive safety measures and reference our process and communications.

meta.content: At the Sugar Valley Rural Charter School, the health, safety and well-being of our students and staff are our top priorities. With the recently elevated discussion regarding the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the news, we want to take a moment to reinforce preventive safety measures and reference our process and communications.

a.title: Unique Aspects of The Proposed Charter School
a.span: Unique Aspects of The Proposed Charter School

li.a: Unique Aspects of The Proposed Charter School

nav.div: Sugar Valley Rural Charter School » News » What's New » Coronavirus

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: At the Sugar Valley Rural Charter School, the health, safety and well-being of our students and staff are our top priorities. With the recently elevated discussion regarding the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the news, we want to take a moment to reinforce preventive safety measures and reference our process and communications.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: As a school, we are closely monitoring the situation and taking guidance from the Pennsylvania Department of Health and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). There is currently no recommendation to close schools in the United States.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
color: rgb(70, 70, 70); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: The CDC recommends travelers avoid all nonessential travel to countries with a level 3 travel advisory at this time.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: We encourage our students, staff and families to be mindful of key preventive measures. The CDC offers some

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: that can be useful in avoiding the spread of this and other illnesses.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Wash your hands regularly, especially after using the restroom and before preparing or consuming food. Using soap and hot water, wash for about 20 seconds. Be sure to also wash your fingertips.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Avoid coughing or sneezing into your hands or in the air. Always try to cough or sneeze into a tissue, and then throw the tissue away. If you don’t have a tissue, cough/sneeze into your arm.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: As much as you can, avoid touching your eyes, mouth and nose.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: In addition, please remember that if children are sick, they should not be at school. Students need to be fever-free for 24 hours before returning to school after any illness.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us. (570) 725-7822
